level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
"Court" means the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.
"Identifying information" means any information which would reasonable lead someone to be able to communicate with or contact a citizen without his or her prior permission.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-272
level.text: Law 16-272, the "Jury Trial Improvements Act of 2006", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-700, which was referred to Committee on Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 2006, and December 19, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 28, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-628 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-272 became effective on March 14, 2007.
